algorithm_technique: Store non-zero elements in a hashmap for efficient lookup and iteration.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the dot product of two vectors that have many zero values.
problem_summary_technical: Efficiently compute dot product by storing non-zero elements in hashmaps and iterating over the smaller one.
time_complexity: O(n) for initialization, O(min(n, m)) for dotProduct
space_complexity: O(n) where n is the number of non-zero elements
key_insights: Storing only non-zero elements significantly reduces space complexity for sparse vectors.
Iterating through the smaller hashmap optimizes the dot product calculation.
The follow-up question about one sparse vector suggests a similar approach, potentially optimizing based on which vector is sparse.
